docs.lead_paragraph: A Maine woman, 18, said the order amounted to a wrongful termination of her parental rights. Welfare officials said the order was appropriate, given the severity of the child’s injuries.

headline.main: Mother, 18, Fights Do-Not-Resuscitate Order for Child
headline.print_headline: Mother, 18, Fights Do-Not-Resuscitate Order for Child

docs.abstract: Virginia Trask, 18-year-old Portland, Me, mother, is fighting do-not-resuscitate order imposed by court on her brain-damaged 1-year-old daughter Aleah Peaslee, saying she should be responsible for medical decisions; child welfare officials who intervened after baby was severely injured in December say lifesaving measures would only prolong her suffering.
docs.snippet: A Maine woman, 18, said the order amounted to a wrongful termination of her parental rights. Welfare officials said the order was appropriate, given the severity of the child’s injuries.

docs.lead_paragraph: Marvin Nicholson, the White House travel director, who has played golf with the president about 140 times, rounds out the president’s foursomes and soothes his frayed feelings.

headline.main: Challenging the President ... but Only on the Golf Course
headline.print_headline: Challenging the President ... but Only on the Golf Course

docs.abstract: Profile of Marvin Nicholson, White House travel director, who has become Pres Obama's most frequent golf partner; Nicholson is known for having a soothing effect on both Obama and others around him.
docs.snippet: Marvin Nicholson, the White House travel director, who has played golf with the president about 140 times, rounds out the president’s foursomes and soothes his frayed feelings.

docs.lead_paragraph: Defending NASCAR champion Jimmie Johnson fell ill following Saturday night's race at Richmond International Raceway and eventually took on five liters of intravenous fluids to treat him for dehydration.

headline.main: Jimmie Johnson Treated for Dehydration After Race
headline.print_headline: Jimmie Johnson Treated for Dehydration After Race

docs.snippet: Defending NASCAR champion Jimmie Johnson fell ill following Saturday night's race at Richmond International Raceway and eventually took on five liters of intravenous fluids to treat him for dehydration.

docs.lead_paragraph: With signature bombast and zeal, Vincent A. Cianci Jr. has exerted outsize influence as candidates scrambled to avoid indirectly helping him by splitting the vote.

headline.main: Candidate Not on Providence Primary Ballot Stirs Mayoral Field
headline.print_headline: Candidate Not on Providence Primary Ballot Stirs Mayoral Field

docs.abstract: Vincent A Cianci Jr, infamous former mayor of Providence, RI, whose two administrations were both cut short by felony convictions, is running again for the office, campaigning as an independent; Cianci will not be on primary ballot, but he has exerted outsize influence on field, which has shrunk as candidates scramble to avoid indirectly helping him by splitting vote.
docs.snippet: With signature bombast and zeal, Vincent A. Cianci Jr. has exerted outsize influence as candidates scrambled to avoid indirectly helping him by splitting the vote.

headline.main: New Answers About Carbs and Fat

docs.abstract: New York Times health reporter Anahad O’Connor answers questions about the latest research on low-carb eating.
docs.snippet: New York Times health reporter Anahad O’Connor answers questions about the latest research on low-carb eating.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York hedge fund manager William Ackman says Herbalife is a pyramid scheme that exploits the poor. He has taken a $1 billion bet against the company’s stock and spent millions on research to attack the nutritional supplements seller, including making a video showing former distributors who claim they were deceived and lost money trying to sell its products.

headline.main: In Herbalife’s Nutrition Clubs, Ackman’s Attacks Fail to Resonate
headline.print_headline: In Herbalife’s Nutrition Clubs, Ackman’s Attacks Fail to Resonate

docs.lead_paragraph: A teenage mother is fighting a do-not-resuscitate order imposed on her brain-damaged daughter, saying she should be responsible for medical decisions. Child welfare officials who intervened after the baby was severely injured say life-saving measures in the event she stops breathing would only prolong her suffering.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chocolate makers in the fast-growing Asian market are replacing a bigger proportion of cocoa butter, which gives confectionery its melt-in-the-mouth texture, with cheaper palm oil-based alternatives.

headline.main: As Cocoa Price Soars, Chocolate Makers Devour Substitutes
headline.print_headline: As Cocoa Price Soars, Chocolate Makers Devour Substitutes

headline.main: A Debate Fueled by Carbs (or the Lack Thereof)

docs.abstract: A new study has found that low-carb diets may be better for cardiovascular health than low-fat ones. But one doctor says focusing on low anything is the wrong approach.
docs.snippet: A new study has found that low-carb diets may be better for cardiovascular health than low-fat ones. But one doctor says focusing on low anything is the wrong approach.
